title: Secure Software Development: Requirements, Design, and Reuse (LFD104)
overview: This course is the first part of the Secure Software Development Fundamentals professional certificate program. It covers foundational practices such as secure design principles, threat modeling, secure requirements engineering, and considerations for component reuse.
requirements: Basic knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC)
Some experience in application architecture and requirements gathering
audience: Designed for developers, software architects, QA testers, and product managers who are involved in the planning and design phases of software projects and want to build security into their workflows.
